We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The Technical Solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers via multi-channel technical support, demos, and presentations. You’ll be joining a team and company where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Engage with customers via multiple channels (ticketing system, live chat, and screensharing tools) to identify and resolve technical support requests while continuing to educate our clients on the use of the platformReproduce technical issues and dive into Datadog’s 600+ integrationsParticipate in product conversations with internal teams based on feedback from client interactionsAcquire expertise across all Datadog GovCloud product areas.Work from a Datadog office 3 - 5 days per week Who You Are:Experienced in multi-channel technical support at a SaaS company (2+ years of related experience)Experienced using SalesForce GovCloud Plus, Jira, Confluence, or similar softwareAn engineer with previous technical troubleshooting and/or programming experienceSelf-motivated, detail-attentive, and have a desire for continuous learning A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approachAn effective written and verbal communicatorA tinkerer with some programming experience and a basic knowledge of LinuxDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive global and US benefitsNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.To conform to US export control regulations, candidates should be eligible for any required authorizations from the US government. Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$77,000—$103,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference. Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. Privacy and AI Guidelines:Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. For information on our AI policy, please visit Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines.Requisition ID: R16232
title: Federal Support Engineer 2 - Denver

job_description: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. You’ll be joining a team and company immersed in a startup-like environment where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do:Engage with customers via multiple channels (ticketing system, live chat, and screensharing tools) to identify and resolve technical support requests while continuing to educate our clients on the use of the platformReproduce technical issues and dive into Datadog’s 400+ integrationsHandle urgent escalation cases that may result in customer-facing troubleshooting calls, and internal or external incident managementAutonomously troubleshoot complex and/or high-priority customer issues without guidanceBecome a subject matter expert in many Datadog product areasDrive product conversations based on needs and problems learned during client interactionsLead high-complexity demos regarding specific and advanced use casesProvide mentorship to junior members of the team and serve as their escalation partnerWork from a Datadog office 3 - 5 days per week Who You Are:A candidate with previous experience supporting clients in the public sector Experienced in multi-channel technical support at a SaaS company (5+ years of related experience)Experienced with APIs, REST calls and an understanding of Network terminologies Familiar with one or more Cloud technologiesAn exceptional written and verbal communicator, with experience communicating complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiencesA strong mentor to your technical peers A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approachSelf-motivated, detail-attentive, and able to continuously learnA tinkerer with programming experience and a mid to advance knowledge of LinuxAble to work an on-call rotating schedule that requires weekend availabilityDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. To conform to U.S. export control regulations, candidates should be eligible for any required authorizations from the U.S. Government. Benefits and Growth:Best-in-breed onboardingGenerous global benefitsIntra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingAn inclusive company culture, able to join our Community Guilds and Inclusion TalksBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$92,000—$122,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. job_description: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The Technical Solutions (TS) team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. The Field CISOs are part of the larger Product Solutions Architecture (PSAs) organization and act as technical multipliers who build lasting, trusted relationships, bridging the gap between customer aspirations and our technology roadmap, enabling digital transformation and ensuring sustained growth for both our customers and our organization. Datadog is growing the Technical Solutions (TS) organization by seeking a customer-focused, industry specialized, and results-oriented Field CISO to join our high-growth organization and oversee our GTM technical strategy for the North America region with primary focus on Information Security.Key RelationshipsReports to the Head of Product Solutions Architecture. Partners closely with all Technical Solutions teams (Product Solutions Architecture, Sales Engineering, Technical Post Sales, Support Engineering) and other internal teams such as Product Management, Sales, Marketing, Global Information Security, Customer Success, Go-To-Market Strategy, Finance, People & Recruiting, and more.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Leadership: Demonstrate Datadog's platform as well as thought leadership in modern Security and Observability, emphasizing our advanced security solutions, industry best practices, and dedication to providing organizations with superior security posture and management of their at scale environments.Advisory: Be a trusted advisor to Sales leaders as well as customer and prospect CISOs and security executives on security ROI, value realization, and vulnerability analysis. Assist with security opportunity and adoption strategy for individual customers within their vertical of expertise.GTM: Identifies industry-specific security threats and trends and their impact during Customer engagements, feeding the top-of-funnel for Product, GTM, BVA, and Architecture teams. Co-create industry security solutions via collaboration with Product SAs and Product Management.C-Level: Strategically guide CISO/CIO/CTO/CEO-level customer and prospect executives in rationalizing their security adoption journey, investment, and operationalizing of security and observability.Collaboration: Collaborate with Product Solutions Architecture (PSA), Sales, Sales Engineering, and Marketing in providing high-quality security-focused technical resources to a broad audience of practitioners and economic buyers.Presentations: Lead security architecture and design engagements to demonstrate how Datadog meets the security needs of strategic customers. Participate in Executive Brief conversations in Datadog’s Executive Briefing Center (EBC) with high-profile customers and prospects about overall security architecture, Security Best Practices, and industry security trends.Hiring: Assist leadership in recruiting and hiring of top talent for the Product Solutions Architecture and Field CTO/CISO teams with a focus on security expertise. Who You Are:Industry Experience: Strong experience of at least 15+ years with Enterprise Security architecture at scale and ability to map modern security-centric architectures to real-world use cases, coupled with deep knowledge of the security and observability space, cloud and application security, as well as technological shifts in the information security space.Strategic Thinker: Able to think long-term and creatively about a wide variety of security and business challenges.Stakeholder Management: Experienced in interacting and influencing key security stakeholders (VP+ and CISO/CIO/CTO level) in large Enterprise organizations.Technologist: Hands-on technologist with a strong security background who gains credibility and establishes strong relationships at all levels of the organization.Presenter: Excellent customer-facing presentation skills for large audiences, comfortable discussing complex security details as well as with briefing executives or non-technical personas on security topics.Communicator: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to link security product functionality to business objectives, security value realization, and ROI.Travel: Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 50% of the timeEducation: Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field, Master’s degree preferredDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Best-in-breed onboardingGenerous global benefitsIntra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingAn inclusive company culture, able to join our Community Guilds and Inclusion TalksBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$280,000—$380,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference. Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. job_description: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The Technical Solutions (TS) team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. The Field CTOs are part of the larger Product Solutions Architecture (PSAs) organization and act as technical multipliers who build lasting, trusted relationships, bridging the gap between customer aspirations and our technology roadmap, enabling digital transformation and ensuring sustained growth for both our customers and our organization. job_description: Datadog is seeking a Field Marketing Manager for the LATAM South (Chile, Argentina, Paraguay, Uruguay) region. This role reports into the Director, LATAM Marketing, based in Brazil.We are seeking an individual with a proven track record in field marketing, a passion for technology, and a dedication to exceeding goals—setting new standards of excellence within the field marketing domain. This candidate consistently applies a growth mindset to their multi-touch, multi-channel approach to driving key account engagement. Your strategic mindset revolves around pipeline development, focusing on how field channels contribute to the global field marketing strategy to yield high-quality leads with best-in-class conversion rates. Collaboration is your forte, as you enjoy working with sales and cross-functional teams to understand colleagues' objectives, KPIs and insights. Your deep market knowledge enables you to be a strategic partner across the GTM organisation.Although we still do not have an office in Chile, WeWork facilities are available to be used in all countries, as at Datadog, we place value in building relationships and work in collaboration with cross teams. What You’ll Do: Create regional field marketing plans utilising regional market knowledge in collaborating with the wider marketing team such as Demand gen, marketing operations and partner marketing to drive strategic planning with clear KPIs, goals, forecasts, workflows, and enablement plans.Gain a comprehensive understanding of our products, market positioning, competition, and Ideal Customer Profile (ICP). Utilise your strategic mindset to build, own, and execute a strategy that focuses on pipeline development for the sales team and awareness of Datadog in the LATAM South region. As a strategic partner across the GTM org, this role will keep the teams informed of the full marketing strategy, their actionable resources, and analysis on what is driving buyer interest in the region.Work with demand generation teams based in the US to regionalize content and optimise messaging for landing pages, email marketing, and paid ads for audience acquisition to regional events and drive engagement for digital campaigns. Develop and deploy field events/programs that deliver the right leads at the right time.Utilise your knowledge of field channels to optimise the regional field marketing strategy and evaluate the success of each program to help inform future plans and roadmaps. Use your solution-oriented approach and outstanding organisational skills to meet deadlines while balancing multiple projects, business partners, and priorities.Proactively collaborate with the partner, sponsored event, and customer event marketing teams, forging strong alliances to enhance existing programs. Integrate their events seamlessly into the overall field marketing strategy, aiming to maximise the ROI on current marketing expenditures. Who You Are: 3-5 years of relevant field marketing experience in B2B SaaS marketing to the enterprise.Native language skills in Spanish as well as exceptional oral, written, and presentation skills in English.Ability to travel up to 40% of the time.Ability to create regional marketing plans and communicate the plans to sales. Experience with CRM (Salesforce), Google Suite, project management and sales enablement workflows.Outstanding organisational skills, ability to follow through, and capable of meeting deadlines while balancing multiple projects and priorities.Passionate about and an expert in delivering compelling field event experiences.Stellar communication and relationship building skills that help you connect with a range of people, from entry-level employees to the C-suite. Apply a growth mindset towards our business, function and your development.Thrive on data and engage with systems to collect, analyse and share data relative to your programs for pipeline planning.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunitiesEmployee-focused best in class onboardingInternal mentor and cross-departmental buddy programFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. job_title: Global Safety & Security Senior Manager - NYC
job_description: The Global Safety & Security Team falls under the Operations Division that runs many day-to-day operational functions that help keep our employees safe, happy and productive. We work closely with leadership and employees to ensure that Datadog continues to scale rapidly, yet smoothly, and remains a fantastic place to work.We’re seeking an experienced team member to join our growing global team and play a critical role in keeping Datadogs and its assets safe and secure. You will work directly with the Head of Global Safety & Security and cross-functional teams to support safety and security operations across the enterprise. Ideal candidates will be passionate about leadership, security operations, building programs, workplace health and safety, project management, customer service, and collaboration. This position is based in our NYC office and will require domestic and international travel. The role will focus particularly on developing our protective services, headquarters security, incident and crisis management programs.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Manage day-to-day global safety and security operations for Datadog’s regional offices in AMER, including its global HQ in NYC and assist with global safety and security initiatives.Oversee a variety of responsibilities, including investigations, health and safety compliance, security risk management, travel safety, event security, budgeting, crisis management, emergency response, property loss management, and global safety and security system management. Enforce Datadog’s security policies and regulations regionally.Document and disseminate security protocols under the guidance of the Head of Global Safety and Security. Develop enterprise-wide access control standards, policies, technical security solutions, safety protocols, emergency preparedness training, and liaise with local law enforcement in individual offices.Collaborate with various teams, including Office Operations, Real Estate, IT, Legal, Executive Assistants, Events and People teams. Maintain regular communication with stakeholders to ensure alignment on global safety and security initiatives, and ensure all teams are trained on emergency plans and incident response protocols.Execute daily operations and strategic initiatives for workplace safety and security, contract security personnel management, and response to incidents in Datadog offices.Identify long-term needs in terms of organizational structure, policies/procedures, and capital enhancements. Develop strategic plans to obtain executive approval, define objectives, secure resources, and execute key milestones.Provide assessments and briefings to leadership, ensuring understanding of corrective actions, their impact, and urgency.Facilitate tabletop exercises for regional offices focused on emergency preparedness, crisis management, and resilience.Who You Are:Experienced in managing safety and security operations, ideally within a fast-paced technology environment, with a focus on developing security and safety programs and incident response plans.Skilled in managing all aspects of a physical security program, including but not limited to Executive Protection, Event Security, and Travel Security.Experienced in building and growing regional and global safety and security programs to scale with organizational needs.Knowledgeable about global technical security monitoring systems, with experience reviewing architectural plans and planning physical security design.Familiarity with enterprise physical security risk management principles, including conducting security and safety risk assessments and implementing mitigation strategies.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey security information across all levels of the organization with specific focus to executives.Strong vendor management capabilities, with a track record of managing and coordinating with external security vendors.10+ years of experience in corporate physical security and safety roles within a global security environment, with specific expertise in North and South American regions.5+ years as a fulltime people manager is essentialDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous career development opportunities Product training to develop understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$160,000—$210,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. job_description: The GTM Strategy & Operations Analyst - C&A will join a global team driving Datadog’s next phase of growth. job_title: GTM Strategy and Operations Senior Associate - Product Strategy
job_description: The GTM Strategy & Operations Senior Associate - Security GTM will join a global team driving Datadog’s next phase of growth. We’re interdisciplinary thinkers working directly with Datadog’s most senior leaders to shape strategy, improve operations, and enable data-driven decision-making across the business. As a member of the GTM Strategy & Operations team, you will support Datadog’s rapidly growing Security business. You will help identify opportunities to accelerate growth, scale and support existing Security initiatives, and ensure our go-to-market approach evolves alongside the product. This role partners closely with our GTM teams and our Product and Product Marketing teams.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. Identify priority customer segments and target accounts for our Security products, and work with the field to ensure appropriate coverage. Prioritize, design, and validate transformation programs to improve Security GTM performance based on quantitative analytics and qualitative insights.Build a strong field/product feedback loop by analysing qualitative and quantitative data and regularly shadowing Sales and Customer Success calls. job_description: We are seeking a high-agency, data-obsessed Head of Sales Programs to architect, launch, and lead targeted, high-propensity outbound pipeline generation and progression initiatives for our Sales organization. This role blends strategic program design, advanced data utilization, cross-functional collaboration, and frontline sales leadership to drive new business growth across our product portfolio.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Design, implement, and operationalize targeted Enterprise outbound sales programs focused on high-propensity accounts. Leverage buying signals, intent data, and account intelligence to isolate ideal Account and Contact targets.Utilize advanced tools, platforms, and data sources to continuously identify, refine, and categorize accounts and/or Contacts into actionable propensity segments. Own the methodology for account prioritization and tracking program effectiveness.Collaborate closely with Enablement, Strategy & Operations, Marketing, Product, and Pricing teams to align outbound initiatives with overall business priorities and ensure seamless execution.Equip Account Executives, SE, and SDR teams with clear Playbooks, talk tracks, competitive positioning, and enablement to execute high-impact prospecting efforts. Personally engage in rep readiness and field coaching.Support sellers throughout the full funnel, from initial outreach through deal nurture and close. Act as a senior partner in high-priority Enterprise opportunities, helping remove obstacles and accelerate outcomes. Leverage new actionable Account Intelligence and “reasons to call” (newly published sales collateral, upcoming events, etc.) to help progress pipeline.Maintain direct accountability for outbound pipeline targets, program-generated revenue, and ROI. Provide regular reporting, insights, and recommendations to executive leadership.Who You Are:10+ years of progressive sales leadership experience in Enterprise SaaS or technology marketsProven success building structured outbound programs that deliver measurable pipeline and revenue resultsDeep expertise in data-driven sales methodologies, intent data, account scoring, and propensity modelingHands-on experience with modern sales technology stacks (e.g., intent platforms, enrichment tools, sequencing software, CRM integrations, analytics platforms)Exceptional collaborator with experience aligning Sales, Marketing, Product, and Revenue Operations functions around a single sales initiativeStrong executive presence and ability to influence senior stakeholders and customer executives, as well individual contributorsComfortable operating in both strategic and tactical capacities — willing to roll up sleeves to support reps and close dealsTrack record of coaching high-performing teams and driving commercial outcomesDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:High income earning opportunities based on self performanceNew hire stock equity (RSU) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, opportunity to join our Community GuildsGenerous global benefitsBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$260,000—$340,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability.
